page.title: 07WITLEY COURT RECENT HISTORY
page.content: In{1920,}following the death of Lady Rachel Foley, Witley Court was sold to {Sir Herbert Smith Bart.}who lived there with his family. On the 7th September{1937}in the owner's absence, a fire broke out near a kitchen chimney and the centre of the building and the east wing were greatly damaged In{1938}after unsuccessful attempts to sell the estate, the contents of the house were sold and also many fixtures and fittings. During the war years the house was in the hands of demolition contractors and fell into a ruinous condition. Parts of the estate were sold in{1946}and{1950.}In{1954}the ruins and adjoining gardens were bought by{Mr. Wiginton}of Stratford. At the present day the court is in the guardianship of the{Historic Buildings {and Monuments Commission.
